channel.title: [317] making levels load automatically
channel.description:
whenever i go up a level through stairs or something, everything is invisible..... i have to log out and then back in for it to load the level....
how can i make it load automatically?

item.title: [317] making levels load automatically
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

yeah but this is what i found:

it loads different levels automatically if you travel far enoguh away for some odd reason
so what i did with the slayer tower was put a portal on the first floor that takes you to the lost and found where you pull one of the 4 apparatus to teleport different levels of the slayer tower…
.
thought it was pretty creative and a unique way to get around the slayer tower…
cause after all, stairs are for squares

ty wasnt sure lol.

item.title: [317] making levels load automatically
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

well you mentioned there was a method to fix this…

so does anyone know that method? or can post a link to a guide on it?

-edit-

ok guys this is really weird…
i used the same code i did for it to go up the slayer tower stair for it to go teleport from a ship to underwater rfd miniquest place and also setheight = 1 and it worked perfectly!

but when i use the same exact code just for th slayer tower stairs,
the level doesnt load! wtf???

-reedit-

ok after testing this out a few more times i found out that using the chain and stairs in slayer tower to go up makes it glitch like this…

i tried using a box from varrock and it teleported me to the second floor without a problem!

i am going to keep testing things out to try to find the best thing i can do, i.e. just add a ladder into the slayer tower to go up.

-another edit-
ok thats really weird… when i set the box in varrock to stay in the same position but go up one level, i got the white glitch… so im assuming that if you go up a level close by then this glitch happens, and if you go long distance then it doesnt… this is really weird…

but any more ideas on how to maybe fix this or get around it or something?

Read full topic

[/quote]

but my client had been worked on so much and all the custom interfaces…

and no other client work with my source…

i just want someone to tell me how to fix this, that would be great… and i would rep them

item.title: [317] making levels load automatically
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

Hm, I’m not too sure then, unless the following works.

Step One:
After adding what I told you to do before, find the place where all your objects are.

Step Two:
Add the following code:

if (objectID == 1738) { stairs = 1; skillX = objectX; skillY = objectY; stairDistance = 2;
NOTE: Change the numbers ‘1738’ to your stair id.

Hopefully that works!

  • Jackson.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] making levels load automatically
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

well basically…

im trying to make the stairs in the Slayer tower work…

so i added that command where when you click the stairs, it teleports you to the same coords but height level changes to 1 so you go to the second floor…

and when i click on the stairs everything is invisible on the second floor and in order to make everything appear i have to log out and then back in…

so im trying to make when i go up the stairs, then it automatically loads the next level

Read full topic

item.title: [317] making levels load automatically
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

Alright, I’m no expert on this situation, but I’ll try to help you in the best way I possibly can.

Step One:
Go in-game, and click on the ladder (purposely do this, so it teleports you to the blank area).

Step Two:
Type the ::mypos command, or whatever command you have built in to tell you the position of where you are in-game.

Step Three:
Read the co-ords. It should say something like the following:

CoOrd [X]: 3016 CoOrd [Y]: 3064

Step Four:
Open your ‘Client.Java’ file, with Notepad or whatever editing program you use to edit your Client.Java, and search for the co-ords.
Search by pressing Control+F, which opens a ‘Find’ box. Type in the [X] Co-Ordinate you got from when in game, after clicking on the stairs and teleporting.

Step Five:
Keep searching, until you find the exact co-ordinates.

Step Six:
It should say something like the following (I think, please remember I’m not expert on this situation):

if (objectX == 3049 && objectY == 4813) { toX = 3029; toY = 4821; }
Basically what it says, is when you click the object that is at [X] 3049, and [Y] 4813, it teleports you to [X] 3029, and [Y] 4821.

What you do, is replace the numbers at toX = 3029, and toY = 4821, to where you want to be teleported once clicked on the stairs.
PLEASE NOTE (IMPORTANT): This object command was from DeltaScape. If you are not using DeltaScape, instead of toY and toX is would be something like teleportToX, or teleportToY.

Step Seven:
Press Control+S, which is the shortcut to save your file, and then close. Once you have both saved and closed the file, open the ‘Compile’ program.

Best of luck!

  • Jackson.

Read full topic
